title: dwgscale11
author: dwgscale11
content: ATH hash scrypt dominant, ATH usage & acceptance, #2 on biggest payment processor Bitpay (previously flipped Bitcoin), declared commodity, ETF looming amongst fidelity EDXM&paypal&venmo&grayscale support, privacy via MWEB, 100% uptime, no premine, fair launch. It’s wakey wakey soon

comments.author: wajik-tempe
comments.body: Its scrypt dominance, historical ATH in hash rate, and broad usage, as seen by its position as Bitpay's second-largest payment processor, portray a hopeful picture. Declarations as a commodity, together with backing from significant organizations like as Fidelity, EDXM, PayPal, Venmo, and Grayscale, strengthen its position. The prospect of an ETF increases the potential upside. The use of MWEB for anonymity, paired with a fair launch, no premine, and steady uptime, increases the legitimacy of Litecoin. Given these variables in the context of the changing crypto environment, the potential of Litecoin's imminent awakening becomes increasingly realistic.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Sleeping giant, indeed? The giant in that comment goes with a question mark because Litecoin has remained embarrassingly on the floor while those other coins on the top list with it have continued to do well. It's even more embarrassing that it slumped after its own halving a few months ago, precisely on 2nd August, 2023 from around $90 to $72 as I type this. I don't want to worry my head over where its price is headed ATM with the few unit I bought but I'm hopeful it might do a triple of its current price once the Bitcoin rally begins proper. This industry is full of unpredictability.

comments.author: strunberg
comments.body: LTC is an old coin and I agree with your opinion about the sleeping giant. LTC has many good things especially smooth transactions and low fees. But little implementation on many exchanges makes me think that LTC will never truly become like ETH, the single best performing altcoin so far.But I love collecting LTC. It's just that I'm trying to look for another altcoin because LTC still uses the POW method which I think is not environmentally friendly enough.

Litecoin is still very good for transactions, but for HODLing, I will always have a rethink, there are better coins/tokens. The coin is seriously challenged for now, it didn't even show any sign that a bull run is happening, and that's too bad. For the 10th position it was before, I don't think it will ever reclaim it again. It's at $72+ with a position of 18, but might get lower in position according to my speculation.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: There was a time when Litecoin was considered a potential altcoin that could make holders financially rich. For now, I do not think it can create anything as of now the developers are not doing active. in 2021 Litecoin achieved an all-time high of $200+ and today after going through its halving it is still 90 percent below its ATH as nothing is happening as development with it. According to me, it was once a good project for anyone looking for cheap transaction fees as of my understanding there are several cryptocurrencies that provide either zero transaction fees or bear minimum transaction fees. Then why would someone hold it or buy it as nothing is going to improve the present situation of Litecoin.
